This garden differs from most botantical gardens I've visited.  The plants are sparsely set up with the striking Moroccan color palette as the defining force.  The effect is pleasing but the plant material itself is not the focal point.
Worth the 70 dirhams entry beautiful gardens in wonderful shade make use of the restaurant with superb club sandwich in elegant surroundings
Nice place. Expect to que for a while at the entrance and it’s almost always full of people. The café inside the mansion is not bad.
review_title: Worth seeing it once at least.

review_text: This is a really beautiful garden and the fountains and house are exquisite. But what else would you expect as it was Yves St Laurent's retreat for many years. YSL Museum is really a must see but the garden is the jewel in the crown. He loved Marrakesh and contributed to the beauty and elegance of city.
Well worth a visit, especially if your kids are suffering from culture shock. The cafe was excellent.
review_title: Tranquility among the dust and chaos

review_text: Lovely gardens and a good trip out for family for a few hours. 70 dirhams. Ideal for people who have family
These gardens are a must visit in Marrakech. Colours and design with beautiful vegetation. Very exotic and refreshing. Excellent maintenance.
review_title: Amazing colours and place. A must in Marrakech

review_text: Beautiful garden away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh. An interesting walk to get there too. We had a delicious meal in the restaurant - lovely soup and smoothie in beautiful surroundings. We arrived a 12 and it was busy. No queue at 3pm when we left. The delicious lunch made up for the 50 minute queue!

A definite worthwhile visit to escape the busy Medina! Only slight issue was that there is alot of tourists in here. The gardens are beaut, the cafe is tranquil and I would recommend the YSL museum next door, especially if you like fashion.
A beautiful garden to while away an hour or two. Really worth a visit if you are in Marrakech.  It does get busy, but the way the garden is set out you can still get around.
Not worthy the price. It is just not a relaxing place and it is too full of tourists. The Yves Saint Laurent museum is small but nice. Nice garden though!

The garden is beautiful and the architecture is stunning, however if you go during busy hours you don't really get to enjoy it for what it is - everybody is waiting to get the 'perfect picture'. I can imagine that going early in the morning the experience is very different. In my opinion, not really worth it if you go after 11.00.
What a nice garden this was! One of the best locations to visit in Marrakech! Very easy to find and good to do in combination with the Yves Saint Laurent museum.

This place is a tiny piece of gem in Marrakech. It makes one feel relaxed as it takes you away from the usual hustle and bustle of Marrakech albeit for a short while. Definitely worth a visit for a change!
It gets packed so get there by 10am. The Yves Saint Laurent museum next door is really stunning. Don't buy anything in the shops on this street.... very over priced

What are beautiful place everything is natural but it looks like from some movie, beautiful and unique plants which we never seen before so many visitors with long queues. Lovely place to spend a day .
Beautiful place, recommend to go early before 11am. Awesome place to take pictures and chill. There is also a café.
worth visiting, for sure. enjoyed every inch of the garden with the spectacular contrast colors and atmosphere. can be crowded
Lovely little place (despite the long queues to get in) with its interesting planting (also has a small café) and a really good Berber Museum which really impressed us.

The entry queues became quite lengthy in the afternoon. The tickets cover the the three attractions; gardens,  Berber and YSL museums, which combined make an interesting outing. The gardens do have amazing cacti and without the crowds would be tranquil but were heaving and the only colour is the blue paint! Go in the morning.

complete overrated. It's not worth to stay for an hour in line to see this small garden place, that's only a still popular name behind that. You have to be there between 8 and 9am, otherwise you will meet a lot of tourist groups.

We visited the Jardin Majorelle on our last trip in 2007 and it was a marvel. Same time of year and day. No queues, not crowded. This time we arrived and the queue was about 50 metres long. Not only that, but we went for a short walk and returned about 15 minutes later and the queue had hardly moved. There was a window for pre-booked tickets but we couldn't find a way of booking on their website. There may indeed be some way of pre-booking, but we didn't bother as we had seen it before.

Very pretty oasis in the middle of Marrakech.  Didn't visit either the Berber Museum or the YSL Museum but we did eat at the restaurant on the premises.  Prices are on the high side and service wasn't great but the setting more than makes up for it!
Very stunning garden! It's definitely worth a visit while you are in Marrakech. There could be a line outside to get in, but it will only take a few minutes. Enjoy it, you will not be disappointed

A small botanical haven in the middle of a bustling city. Lots to see and enjoy at this beautiful garden. A whole array of tropical cacti and picturesque ponds to view. There is also a small restaurant in an outside walled garden. Definitely worth a visit. Would fully recommend.
The design and architecture is lovely and the blue is beautiful and complemented by the fabulous planting.

This is in the posh new side of Marrakech. The layout is beautiful and nicely maintained m. It is a place where family, romantic couples, retired all will enjoy. We only took the ticket for gardens and not the berber museum as we had visited berber house already. The garden itself is big and you can easily spend 2 hours. The house in the middle of the garden is really beautiful. Its really worth the money.
Hidden gem of Marrakech. Lovely to walk around the gardens- very colourful and peaceful. Would definately recommend a visit!

Beautiful gardens full of exotic pal!s, cacti and bamboos creating a relaxing tropical forest feel. Despite being busy it still managed to feel like an escape from the busy world outside the garden walls.
A beautiful collection of bamboo and cactus. Probably better to visit when is quite morning early around 09 till 11am

One of the supposed highlights when visting Marrakech, but not anymore. I've been here two times before and enjoyed it, but the sheer amount of tourists hanging around takes the pleasure away. I strongly recommend to cap off the number of visitors at any time, but that will be no part of the business model of this place. Go early, as qeueing times can be up to half an hour !

I am not that interested in fashion but the display of YSL design clothes was excellent. The displays of Berber jewellery and clothes demonstrated the impact on YSL and the main source of his inspiration.
review_title: Well presented displays in a lovely setting

review_text: Its a nice area but nothing special!Just a normal garden area..I think the 7euros entrance is expensive!

Guess the question is was it worth the long queue and cost of entry. Though nice not that great. Too many people and you don't get a chance to relax. We actually enjoyed the weirdly named cyber park more!

There are long line ups to purchase tickets, but there are guides across the street who have access to tickets - they will purchase for you so you can skip the line.  Plan to spend about an hour - there is lots to see.
review_title: Very peaceful setting in the middle of city

review_text: It gets very busy but you can still manage to enjoy the gardens and scenery.  The would be models using the house as a photo shoot add another dimension.
An amazing visit. Go early morning to avoid the crowds of tourists. Easy to get a taxi from right outside - avoid the hassle from unlicensed drivers.
review_title: Go early to avoid the crowds

review_text: This garden is well worth a visit. It was very popular so expect lots of fellow tourists but the ten minutes of orderly queuing for a ticket yielded a delightful garden and a very well presented Berber museum. The garden is beautifully set out and impeccably tended. The museum, although not large, displayed a wide range of well labelled traditional Berber clothing and artefacts. After the bustle of the medina this was a true oasis.

We travelled to Marrakech in February, so it isn't the high season for tourism. However, the queues were very long and there were people everywhere in the park. Especially in the most beautiful spots people needed to actually form queues to take photos in that spot. However, I really enjoyed the park and it was very beautiful! I would recommend to buy tickets online so you can go in faster. I recommend to buy the combination ticket for the park, the Berber museum and YSL museum, which is down the road from the park.

Probably one of the best attractions in Marrakech but come early as it is not enjoyable when it is surrounded by tourists. I got there very early and had a pleasant experience. When i stepped out, the queues appeared to very long, there was no queue in the morning. So go a bit early. Had breakfast inside the cafe, which was decent as well.
A total paradise to explore. Would highly recommend-and the hot chocolates at the cafe too were pretty fantastic.
such a great place with lot of history behind... for those who love peace, art and fashion ! Maybe the best garden in Marrakech together with Secret Jardin .

If visiting the garden it is definitely worth buying tickets in advance as there is usually a long queue to buy tickets at the gate. However if you walk a further 200 meters to the YSL Museum and buy a joint ticket there usually isn't a queue to enter the museum then go back to the garden and jump the queue. The gardens are a very peaceful and tranquil oasis in a frenetic city and are well worth the visit.

We loved it- recommend going to the YSL museum first...buy a ticket for garden and museum together...do the museum first as queues big in the morning for the garden...you can then skip the queue for the garden and get straight in. Really enjoyed the film about YSL in the museum. The garden has a lovely courtyard cafe....amazing plants/cacti

This garden is absolutely a must see stop during your visit in Marrakech! Such a beautiful garden with lovely flowers. The color blue really stands out in the beautiful sun. Be on time, that way you avoid the storm of visitors!

A must see on a trip to Marrakech - We bought the combination ticket at the YSL Museum and visited this first. We all enjoyed this beautiful and well presented museum to YSL - especially the display of many Haute Couture outfits on display from over the many decades Nearby are the stunning gardens which are so peaceful after the bustle of the city. A photographers dream - the colours are just amazing Go early to avoid the crowds or later in the afternoon would be a good time too
review_title: Stunning gardens! An oasis of calm in Marrakech

review_text: Enjoyed the gardens, the architecture and colors of the studio-now-turned-Berber-museum. Recommend picking a warm day to visit - we went on a cold, rainy day which made it less enjoyable. While in the area: definitely worth to visit Musee Saint Yves Laurent which is located outside the gardens around the corner from the entrance. Consider getting  the combination ticket.

What a wonderful garden of succulents. We loved every moment of it and have never seen so many cacti in one place! The layout of the gardens coupled with the house of Yves St. Lauent make this a truly magic place, so serene, so calming within the hustle and bustle of the city! We highly recommend a visit (70 dirhams per person).

The garden was a relaxing change of pace to the Marrakech hectic streets. The exotic plants and tree bring fresh air for a relaxing day. There are many colorful aspects to the gardens: plants, vases, building, etc. Our experience took about 1 Hour at a very casual pace. We only visited the gardens and not the museum.

Definitely worth a visit while in Marrakesh as it is stunning.   However, contrary to the guidebook description of it being ‘an oasis of calm’, it was very busy when we were there.  Many tourists with selfie sticks more interested in taking photos of themselves than the garden.  However, I would still recommend.
This garden is a must see if you visit Marakech, the price at the entry is 100 dirhams for both the garden and the Berber museum, in the middle, is a nice cafe with decent prices.
not much to visit, quite small, the walls are painted to have the pretty color. too many visitors taking photo. the museum was closed on the day we visited, quite a shame, try to avoid Wednesday!
review_title: overrated place but you still want to visit
